text.headline: The giant timeline of everything Russia, Trump and the investigations
text.text: By Lisa Desjardins

text.headline: Access Hollywood tape revealed.
text.text: Washington Post / Trump recorded having extremely lewd conversation about women in 2005

text.headline: Second presidential debate brings up hacking.
text.text: Washington Post / Everything that was said at the second Donald Trump vs. Hillary Clinton debate, highlighted

text.headline: Putin denies role in U.S. elections.

text.headline: NYT first reports Donald Trump Jr. 2016 meeting with Russian lawyer.
text.text: New York Times / Trump Team Met With Lawyer Linked to Kremlin During Campaign

text.headline: Donald Trump Jr. releases emails about meeting with Russian lawyer after offer of anti-Hillary Clinton material.
text.text: New York Times / Read the Emails on Donald Trump Jr.’s Russia Meeting

text.headline: U.S. Senate sends new Russia sanctions to Trump's desk.
text.text: CNN / Senate sends Russia sanctions to Trump's desk

text.headline: Russia reacts to sanctions bill, expelling U.S. diplomats.
text.text: NPR / Putin To Expel 755 U.S. Diplomats And Staff From Russia In Response To New Sanctions

text.headline: Trump signs new sanctions against Russia, but says bill is "flawed."
text.text: Reuters / Trump signs Russia sanctions bill, Moscow calls it 'trade war'

text.headline: Putin elected to six more years in office.
text.text: The Guardian / Vladimir Putin secures landslide victory in Russian election

text.headline: New U.S. sanctions against Russian oligarchs.
text.text: US Department of Treasury / Treasury Designates Russian Oligarchs, Officials, and Entities in Response to Worldwide Malign Activity

text.headline: FBI begins investigating Hillary Clinton's use of a private email server while Secretary of State.
text.text: Washington Post / FBI looking into the security of Hillary Clinton’s private e-mail setup

text.headline: Intel director tells of attempted cyberattacks on presidential campaigns.
text.text: Politico / Clapper: Cyber threats against presidential campaigns are growing

text.headline: DNC's cybersecurity firm reports that Russians hacked the party's system.
text.text: Crowdstrike / Bears in the Midst: Intrusion into the Democratic National Committee »

text.headline: Comey closes Clinton email investigation.
text.text: Federal Bureau of Investigation / Statement by FBI Director James B. Comey on the Investigation of Secretary Hillary Clinton’s Use of a Personal E-Mail System

text.headline: FBI begins investigation of DNC hack.
text.text: Fox News / FBI to investigate DNC email hack

text.headline: FBI receives letter from Page defending his communications.
text.text: Washington Post

text.headline: DHS, DNI confirm Russian hacking of DNC.
text.text: Department of Homeland Security / Joint Statement from the Department Of Homeland Security and Office of the Director of National Intelligence on Election Security

text.headline: Comey reopens Clinton investigation.
text.text: Washington Post / Oct. 28 FBI letter to congressional leaders on Clinton email investigation

text.headline: Comey again closes Clinton investigation.
text.text: New York Times / Letter From F.B.I. Related to Clinton Email Case

text.headline: Congressional Republican leaders announce they will investigate Russian attempts to disrupt the election.
text.text: USA Today / Republican leaders join outrage at Russia, will investigate hacks

text.headline: Sen. Intell. Committee launches its Russia investigation.
text.text: New York Times / Intercepted Russian Communications Part of Inquiry Into Trump Associates

text.headline: Sens. Warren, Cardin ask Treasury to investigate Scaramucci-Russia Fund interaction.
text.text: US Senate

text.headline: Flynn questioned by the FBI.
text.text: ABC News / A timeline of Sally Yates’ warnings to the White House about Mike Flynn

text.headline: Acting AG Sally Yates hears about Flynn interview.
text.text: ABC News / A timeline of Sally Yates’ warnings to the White House about Mike Flynn

text.headline: Yates warns White House counsel Don McGahn about Flynn.
text.text: ABC News / A timeline of Sally Yates’ warnings to the White House about Mike Flynn

text.headline: Treasury Sec. Mnuchin does not say if Scaramucci violated sanctions policy.
text.text: US Senate

text.headline: The FBI interviews Papadopoulos a second time.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: House Intelligence Committee launches Russia investigation.
text.text: House of Representatives

text.headline: Comey pubicly verifies FBI investigation of Russia and Trump campaign connections.
text.text: Washington Post / Full transcript: FBI Director James Comey testifies on Russian interference in 2016 election

text.headline: Nunes visits White House grounds, learns about incidental surveillance of Trump associates.
text.text: Wired / Devin Nunes: A Timeline of His White House Visits and Trump Surveillance Claims

text.headline: Nunes personally briefs president on surveillance news.
text.text: AJC / Read transcripts of Rep. Devin Nunes’ news conferences about Trump surveillance

text.headline: Nunes cancels House intelligence hearing with Yates and former intelligence heads.
text.text: CNN / Partisan split at House intel committee over canceled open hearing

text.headline: Trump fires Comey.
text.text: CNN / Trump's letter firing FBI Director James Comey

text.headline: Washington Post reports Mueller is investigating Trump for possible obstruction of justice.
text.text: Washington Post / Special counsel is investigating Trump for possible obstruction of justice, officials say

text.headline: CNN: Near this date, intelligence chiefs told senators that the president asked them to deny any colllusion with Russia.
text.text: CNN / Intel chiefs tell investigators Trump suggested they refute collusion with Russians

text.headline: Trump attorney Jay Sekulow says he has not been told the president is under investigation for obstruction.
text.text: Reuters / Trump lawyer says president not informed he is under investigation

text.headline: Following Mueller request, White House directs staff to preserve documents.
text.text: CNN / Mueller asks WH to preserve info from Trump Jr. meeting

text.headline: Report: Mueller expands investigation to include Trump business dealings.
text.text: Bloomberg / Mueller Expands Probe to Trump Business Transactions

text.headline: Manafort meets with Senate Intelligence Committee staff, who ask about June 2016 Trump Tower meeting.
text.text: New York Times / Manafort Talks With Senate Investigators About Meeting With Russians

text.headline: FBI agents raid Manafort's home.
text.text: Washington Post / FBI conducted predawn raid of former Trump campaign chairman Manafort’s home

text.headline: Investor Bill Browder to senators: Veselnitskaya was pushing Moscow's agenda at 2016 Trump Tower meeting.
text.text: Foreign Policy / Browder Says “No Doubt” Lawyer Who Met With Trump Jr. a Russian Agent

text.headline: Trump campaign turns over 20,000 pages of documents to Senate Judiciary Committee.
text.text: Bloomberg / Trump Campaign Turns Over Thousands of Documents in Russia Probe

text.headline: Donald Trump Jr. turns over 250 pages of documents to Senate Judiciary Committee.
text.text: Bloomberg / Trump Campaign Turns Over Thousands of Documents in Russia Probe

text.headline: As Trump's attorney, Cohen sends letter to Congressional investigators disputing the Steele "dossier."
text.text: Fox News / Trump attorney delivers point-by-point rebuttal of 'totally false' dossier

text.headline: Senate Judiciary Committee daylong hearing with Fusion GPS founder.
text.text: PBS / Founder of firm tied to Trump dossier meets with Senate committee in Russia probe

text.headline: NYT report details Russian fake accounts, bots on Twitter and Facebook.
text.text: New York Times / The Fake Americans Russia Created to Influence the Election

text.headline: U.S. bans government use of security software by firm connected to Russians.
text.text: Washington Post / U.S. moves to ban Kaspersky software in federal agencies amid concerns of Russian espionage

text.headline: Facebook gives Mueller information on Russian ads.
text.text: Wall Street Journal / Facebook Gave Special Counsel Robert Mueller More Details on Russian Ad Buys Than Congress

text.headline: DHS identifies 21 state election systems targeted by Russian hackers.
text.text: Politico / States finally find out: Did Russian hackers target them?

text.headline: Roger Stone closed-door testimony on Capitol Hill. Refuses to name who worked with him and Assange.
text.text: Politico / Roger Stone brings theatrics to Capitol Hill

text.headline: Papadopoulos signs plea agreement, guilty of lying to FBI and agreeing to cooperate.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: Report: Mueller investigation includes Tony Podesta, brother of Clinton campaign Chairman John Podesta, for work connected to Manafort. (NYT)
text.text: NBC News / Mueller Now Investigating Democratic Lobbyist Tony Podesta

text.headline: WaPo publishes report that Clinton campaign paid Fusion GPS for anti-Trump research, including Steele dossier.
text.text: Washington Post / Clinton campaign, DNC paid for research that led to Russia dossier

text.headline: Mueller investigation indicts Manafort and his lieutenant Rick Gates on charges related to their past work for Ukrainian politicians.
text.text: Washington Post / Three former Trump campaign officials charged by special counsel

text.headline: Twitter, Google and Facebook representatives testify before Congress on Russian meddling.
text.text: The Guardian / Facebook, Google and Twitter grilled by Congress over Russian meddling – as it happened

text.headline: Sessions testifies he now recalls the 2016 Papadopolous meeting.
text.text: Washington Post / Sessions again changes his account of what he knew about Trump campaign’s dealings with Russians

text.headline: Senate Judiciary Committee: Kushner didn't tell us about Wikileaks emails and talks for a "backdoor" channel with Russians.
text.text: Washington Post / Senate Judiciary panel: Kushner had contacts about WikiLeaks, Russian overtures he did not disclose

text.headline: Mueller's team and the president's attorneys discuss the possibility of him testifying, according to letter obtained by NYT.
text.text: New York Times / The Trump Lawyers’ Confidential Memo to Mueller, Explained

text.headline: Erik Prince testifies before House Intelligence Committee.
text.text: Washington Post / Erik Prince tells House investigators he met with Kremlin-linked banker in Seychelles

text.headline: Mueller's team and the president's attorneys again discuss the possibility of him testifying, according to letter obtained by NYT.
text.text: New York Times / The Trump Lawyers’ Confidential Memo to Mueller, Explained

text.headline: White House outlines its cooperation with Mueller, points to 20+ interviews by Trump staffers.
text.text: Washington Post / Special counsel investigators have interviewed more than 20 White House officials, Trump’s legal team says

text.headline: Trump attorney John Dowd drafts letter to Mueller arguing that the president has the power to shut down investigations and that, because of such powers, his actions could never be obstruction of justice.
text.text: New York Times / The Trump Lawyers’ Confidential Memo to Mueller, Explained

text.headline: House Intelligence Republicans release once-classified memo accusing FBI of bias.
text.text: DocumentCloud

text.headline: Mueller's team brings a second indictment, with 32 counts of tax and bank fraud, against Paul Manafort and Rick Gates.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: Gates pleads guilty to two lesser charges, becomes a cooperating witness.
text.text: Washington Post / Former Trump campaign official Rick Gates pleads guilty to 2 charges

text.headline: House Intelligence Democrats release a counter-memo on the FBI.
text.text: NPR / Redacted Democratic Response To Nunes Memo Defends FBI Surveillance Of Trump Aide

text.headline: DOJ inspector general launches investigation of FBI, DOJ and possible abuse of FISA/surveillance powers, including with the Carter Page wiretaps.
text.text: Fox News / DOJ Inspector General reviews alleged FISA abuses by DOJ, FBI

text.headline: Sen. Intelligence Committee interviews Felix Sater, who worked on Russia deals with Trump.
text.text: BuzzFeed / Senate Investigators Spent 7 Hours Interviewing A Former Trump Business Associate Who Tried To Get Him A Deal With Moscow

text.headline: House Intelligence Committee releases separate final reports from GOP and Dems. Republicans conclude no evidence of collusion.
text.text: House of Representatives / Intel Committee Publishes Russia Report

text.headline: Senate Intelligence Committee: Russia tried to interfere in 2016 election to help Donald Trump.
text.text: Washington Post / Russia favored Trump in 2016, Senate panel says, breaking with House GOP

text.headline: Reuters report: Manafort's ex-son-in-law Jeffrey Yohai agreed to a plea deal in real estate case, may have to cooperate with Mueller.
text.text: Reuters / Exclusive: Manafort's former son-in-law cuts plea deal, to cooperate with government - sources

text.headline: Mueller drops a new obstruction of justice indictment against Manafort and his associate Konstantin Kilimnik. They are the first charges against Kilimnik.
text.text: New York Times / Mueller Adds Obstruction Charge on Manafort and Indicts His Right-Hand Man

text.headline: Russia is ousted from the G8 group of industrial nations, because of its move to annex Crimea.
text.text: New York Times / Russia Is Ousted From Group of 8 by U.S. and Allies

text.headline: CNN reports the State Deptartment suspects Russians are behind a continuing, nearly yearlong and "worst ever" hack.
text.text: CNN / Sources: State Dept. hack the 'worst ever'

text.headline: U.S. cybersecurity expert says he is seeing dramatic rise in cyber aggression from Russia.
text.text: The Daily Beast / Obama to Putin: Stop Hacking Me

text.headline: DOD secretary Ashton Carter reveals suspected Russian hack of Pentagon.
text.text: CNN

text.headline: Russians launch cyberattack against the Pentagon's Joint Staff email system. Officials shut it down temporarily.
text.text: CNBC / Russia hacks Pentagon computers: NBC, citing sources

text.headline: The @Ten_GOP twitter account is created. It's purported to be the Tennessee Republicans but is later reported to be Russian trolls. It pushes support of Michael Flynn, allegations of vote fraud and gets dozens of RT's from Trump campaign staffers.
text.text: The Daily Beast / Trump Campaign Staffers Pushed Russian Propaganda Days Before the Election

text.headline: Clinton campaign chair John Podesta opens a phishing email sent by Russian hackers.
text.text: New York Times / The Perfect Weapon: How Russian Cyberpower Invaded the U.S.

text.headline: Another Clinton staffer falls for phishing scam.
text.text: New York Times / The Perfect Weapon: How Russian Cyberpower Invaded the U.S.

text.headline: The "professor" tells Trump advisor Papadopoulos that Russians have "thousands" of Hillary Clinton emails.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: DNC announces it was hacked.
text.text: Washington Post / Russian government hackers penetrated DNC, stole opposition research on Trump

text.headline: Guccifer 2.0 claims DNC hack, leaks report on Trump.
text.text: The Smoking Gun / DNC Hacker Releases Trump Oppo Report

text.headline: Guccifer 2.0 leaks DNC hack documents about Clinton.
text.text: guccifer / Dossier on Hillary Clinton from DNC

text.headline: Wikileaks releases 20,000 DNC emails.
text.text: New York Times / Released Emails Suggest the D.N.C. Derided the Sanders Campaign

text.headline: Hackers release cell phone numbers, personal information and other documents about Democratic members of Congress.
text.text: New York Times / Hacker Releases More Democratic Party Documents

text.headline: Russian hackers targeted U.S. voting software company, according to NSA.
text.text: The Intercept / Top-Secret NSA Report Details Russian Hacking Effort Days Before 2016 Election

text.headline: Wikileaks posts Podesta emails from DNC hack.
text.text: Politifact / It's True: WikiLeaks dumped Podesta emails hour after Trump video surfaced

text.headline: Obama admin. warns Russia to stop hacking.
text.text: Wall Street Journal / White House Vows ‘Proportional’ Response for Russian DNC Hack

text.headline: Hackers use stolen logins to send cyberattack emails to 122 local voting officials.
text.text: The Intercept / Top-Secret NSA Report Details Russian Hacking Effort Days Before 2016 Election

text.headline: Wikileaks releases CIA documents.
text.text: Wikileaks / Vault7

text.headline: Putin denies role in U.S. elections, suggests "patriotic hackers" outside government may be behind hack.
text.text: The Atlantic / Putin Says 'Patriotic Hackers' May Have Targeted U.S. Election

text.headline: Russia denies using Facebook to try to influence the election.
text.text: Reuters / Kremlin: Russia did not use Facebook adverts to sway U.S. election

text.headline: Report: Russian trolling operation likely cost $2.3 million, reached 6 million people.
Trump says G7 summit nations "should let Russia come back in."
text.text: BBC / G7: Trump isolated over trade and Russia on first day

text.headline: Trump sends letter to Putin inviting him to the Miss Universe pageant, according to the Washington Post.
text.text: Washington Post / In a personal letter, Trump invited Putin to the 2013 Miss Universe pageant

text.headline: Trump tells David Letterman: "I've done a lot of business with the Russians."
text.text: You Tube / Donald Trump on David Letterman 17 October, 2013 Full Interview

text.headline: Trump holds Miss Universe (which he owns) in Moscow, meets Russian entrepreneurs.
text.text: Bloomberg / The Day Trump Came to Moscow: Oligarchs, Miss Universe and Nobu

text.headline: Trump tweets that U.S. must be strategic with Russia.
text.text: Twitter / Donald J. Trump on Twitter

text.headline: Trump announces candidacy for president.
text.text: You Tube / Donald Trump Presidential Campaign Announcement Full Speech (C-SPAN)

text.headline: Trump and Flynn first meet, speak for 90 minutes.
text.text: Washington Post / Trump adviser Michael T. Flynn on his dinner with Putin and why Russia Today is just like CNN

text.headline: Trump and Putin praise each other, saying in separate statements they want better relations.
text.text: Yahoo / From Russia with love: Putin, Trump sing each other's praises

text.headline: Trump meets with his national security team, including Sessions and Papadopoulos. The latter says he could arrange a meeting with Putin.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: Trump meets Russian ambassador Sergey Kislyak.
text.text: The Independent / Donald Trump met Russian ambassador Sergey Kislyak during election campaign

text.headline: Russian magnate Aras Agalarov delivers an "expensive painting" to Trump for his birthday.
text.text: House of Representatives

text.headline: Trump accuses DNC of being behind the hack of their system.
text.text: Politico / Trump accuses DNC of 'hacking' its own oppo research on him

text.headline: Trump writes effusive thank you note to Agalarov for the painting.
text.text: House of Representatives

text.headline: Trump fires campaign manager Corey Lewandowski, Manafort takes over.
text.text: Fox News / Canning Corey: Why Trump firing Lewandowski could shift his campaign

text.headline: Trump gives NYC speech focused on his criticism of Hillary Clinton. It's unclear if this is what he was signaling June 7.
text.text: Politico / Full transcript: Donald Trump NYC speech on stakes of the election

text.headline: Trump says he hopes Russia finds missing Clinton emails.
text.text: CNBC / Trump: I hope Russia finds 'the 30,000 emails that are missing'

text.headline: Trump: Crimea prefers Russia.
text.text: ABC News / Trump: Crimea's People Prefer Russia, But If He's Elected Putin Is 'Not Going Into Ukraine'

text.headline: Trump to Russian TV: Russia interference "pretty unlikely."
text.text: Politico / Trump on RT: Johnson shouldn't debate; Russian election interference 'probably unlikely'

text.headline: Russia formally complains to U.N. about criticism of Trump, others.
text.text: Associated Press / APNewsBreak: UN criticism of Trump draws Russian complaint

text.headline: Trump team says Page made "no contribution" to the campaign.
text.text: The Hill / Trump camp backs away from adviser suspected of Kremlin ties

text.headline: Washington Post uncovers lewd Trump comments on Access Hollywood tape.
text.text: Washington Post / Trump recorded having extremely lewd conversation about women in 2005

text.headline: Trump doubts U.S. intel on Russia.
text.text: NBC News / Trump Has Been Strikingly Consistent in Denying Russian Hacking Role

text.headline: Trump praises Comey for reopening Clinton email probe.
text.text: The Guardian / Donald Trump praises FBI director for letter to Congress – video

text.headline: Trump, named Time's 2016 person of the year, tells the magazine, "I do not believe Russia interfered."
text.text: Time / Donald Trump: TIME Person of the Year Interview Transcript

text.headline: Putin sends Trump a letter asking to restore U.S.-Russia relationship.
text.text: Politico / Trump releases letter from Putin asking to 'restore' U.S.-Russia relationship

text.headline: In Senate intelligence hearing, Comey won't say if FBI is investigating Trump.
text.text: The Guardian / James Comey refuses to tell Senate if FBI is investigating Trump-Russia links

text.headline: Trump calls Comey over to shake hands during a White House reception.
text.text: LA Times / At a White House reception, Trump has a pat on the back for FBI Director James Comey

text.headline: Trump fires Yates for ordering DOJ not to defend the president's travel ban.
text.text: Fortune / President Trump Fires Acting Attorney General Sally Yates

text.headline: NYT: Trump instructs top WH lawyer to stop Sessions from recusing himself in the Russia investigation.
text.text: New York Times / Obstruction Inquiry Shows Trump’s Struggle to Keep Grip on Russia Investigation

text.headline: On Twitter, Trump says Obama had his "wires tapped" during 2016 elections.
text.text: Politifact / A timeline of Donald Trump’s false wiretapping charge

text.headline: Comey asks DOJ to publicly deny Trump's wiretap charge.
text.text: New York Times / Comey Asks Justice Dept. to Reject Trump’s Wiretapping Claim

text.headline: On or near this date,Trump reportedly asks intelligence chiefs to deny coordination between Russia and his campaign.
text.text: Washington Post / Trump asked intelligence chiefs to push back against FBI collusion probe after Comey revealed its existence

text.headline: Trump reportedly asks Director of National Intelligence Daniel Coats to get Comey to back off investigation into Flynn.
text.text: Washington Post / Top intelligence official told associates Trump asked him if he could intervene with Comey on FBI Russia probe

text.headline: Comey says Trump called him at the FBI and,  describing the Russia investigation as a "cloud," asked Comey to publicly say the president was not under investigation.
text.text: US Senate

text.headline: Trump calls Comey a "phony," tweeting the FBI director "was the best thing that ever happened to Hillary Clinton."
text.text: Twitter / Donald J. Trump on Twitter

text.headline: Trump tweets that story about campaign collusion with Russia is a "total hoax."
text.text: Twitter / Donald J. Trump on Twitter

text.headline: Trump fires Comey.
text.text: CNN / Trump's letter firing FBI Director James Comey

text.headline: Trump retains adviser Marc Kasowitz as his private attorney for Russia probe.
text.text: Reuters / Trump retains Marc Kasowitz as private attorney for Russia probe: source

text.headline: Trump tweets that obstruction of justice allegations are part of a "witch hunt."
text.text: Twitter / Donald J. Trump on Twitter

text.headline: WaPo, NYT: Near this date, Trump ordered that Mueller be fired, but relented after White House counsel Don McGahn threatened to quit.
text.text: New York Times / Trump Ordered Mueller Fired, but Backed Off When White House Counsel Threatened to Quit

text.headline: New York Times reports Trump transition team orders former staff to keep all documents related to Russia or Ukraine.
text.text: New York Times / Trump Transition Team Orders Former Aides to Preserve Russia-Related Materials

text.headline: Trump tweets that he is being investigated "for firing the FBI director by the man who told me to fire the FBI director."
text.text: Twitter / Donald J. Trump on Twitter

text.headline: Trump again tweets the investigation is a "witch hunt."
text.text: Twitter / Donald J. Trump on Twitter

text.headline: Spicer says he does not know if Trump believes the Russians tried to meddle in the election.
text.text: Time / Spicer Won't Say If Trump Believes Russia Election Meddling

text.headline: In a FOX News interview, the president implies he may not want Mueller in the job.
text.text: Business Insider / Trump appears to float a major shake-up in the Russia investigation during Fox News interview

text.headline: Trump admits he does not have Oval Office tapes of Comey conversation.
text.text: The Guardian / Trump admits: 'I did not make, and do not have' tapes of Comey conversations

text.headline: The president acknowledges "Russian meddling" in a tweet, accuses Obama of doing nothing.
text.text: Twitter / Donald J. Trump on Twitter

text.headline: NYT reports Trump signed off on his son's statement about meeting with Russian lawyer.
text.text: New York Times / Rancor at White House as Russia Story Refuses to Let the Page Turn

text.headline: Trump attorney says POTUS not involved in drafting his son's statement about Russia meeting.
text.text: CNN / Timeline of Donald Trump Jr.'s meeting revelations

text.headline: President Trump's attorney again denies POTUS had role in Trump Jr. statement.
text.text: NBC News / Meet the Press - July 16, 2017

text.headline: Trump praises son for releasing Russia meeting emails.
text.text: Twitter / Donald J. Trump on Twitter

text.headline: To NYT, Trump criticizes Sessions for recusing himself from Russia investigation.
text.text: New York Times / Excerpts From The Times’s Interview With Trump

text.headline: Trump tells Wall Street Journal he's "just looking at" firing Sessions.
text.text: Wall Street Journal / Excerpts: Donald Trump’s Interview With The Wall Street Journal

text.headline: White House says Trump did weigh in on son's statement to NYT.
text.text: CNN / Trump 'weighed in' on son's statement about Russia meeting, White House says

text.headline: Trump misses the Oct. 1 deadline to impose new, required sanctions against Russia.
text.text: US Senate / SENATORS McCAIN & CARDIN QUESTION ADMINISTRATION DELAY IN RUSSIA SANCTIONS IMPLEMENTATION

text.headline: Trump tweets that events in Manafort indictment occurred before he was in the campaign and that there was no collusion.
text.text: Twitter / Donald J. Trump on Twitter

text.headline: At an Asian summit,Trump says Putin again privately assured him "he didn't meddle."
text.text: New York Times / Trump Says Putin ‘Means It’ About Not Meddling

text.headline: Trump tells reporters he accepts U.S. intel over Putin on meddling, saying "I'm with our agencies."
text.text: Associated Press / Trump: 'I'm with our agencies' on Russian election meddling

text.headline: Mueller's team and the president's attorneys discuss the possibility of him testifying, according to letter obtained by NYT.
text.text: New York Times / The Trump Lawyers’ Confidential Memo to Mueller, Explained

text.headline: Mueller's team and the president's attorneys again discuss the possibility of him testifying, according to letter obtained by NYT.
text.text: New York Times / The Trump Lawyers’ Confidential Memo to Mueller, Explained

text.headline: Trump attorney John Dowd drafts letter to Mueller arguing that the president has the power to shut down investigations and that, because of such powers, his actions could never be obstruction of justice.
text.text: New York Times / The Trump Lawyers’ Confidential Memo to Mueller, Explained

text.headline: Trump's personal lawyer, John Dowd, said he hopes Deputy Attorney General Rosenstein shuts down the Mueller investigation.
text.text: The Daily Beast / Trump’s Lawyer: It’s Time to End the Mueller Probe

text.headline: Trump congratulates Putin on re-election, despite staff warning "do not congratulate."
text.text: New York Times / Trump Congratulates Putin, but Doesn’t Mention Meddling in U.S.

text.headline: John Dowd, Trump's attorney for the Mueller investigation, resigns.
text.text: New York Times / Trump’s Lawyer Resigns as President Adopts Aggressive Approach in Russia Inquiry

text.headline: Trump halts plan for possible new economic sanctions on Russia.
text.text: Washington Post / Trump puts the brakes on new Russian sanctions, reversing Haley’s announcement

text.headline: Trump rails against DOJ, FBI and Mueller in FOX interview. Also confirms Cohen worked for him  but was a "tiny, tiny fraction" of his legal work.
text.text: Washington Post / Trump’s unwieldy ‘Fox and Friends’ interview, annotated

text.headline: White House announces lead Russia probe lawyer Ty Cobb is leaving, will be replaced by Emmet Flood.
text.text: New York Times / Trump’s Lawyer Resigns as President Adopts Aggressive Approach in Russia Inquiry

text.headline: Trump demands DOJ investigate whether DOJ or the FBI spied on his campaign for political purposes.
text.text: Twitter / Donald J. Trump on Twitter

text.headline: Trump tweets he wished he had picked someone other than Sessions as attorney general.
text.text: Twitter / Donald J. Trump on Twitter

text.headline: Trump tweets that he "never fired James Comey because of Russia."
text.text: Twitter / Donald J. Trump on Twitter

text.headline: The NYT publishes Jan. letter by Trump's attorney asserting obstruction of justice charges could not apply to the president. The letter also indicates Trump dictated the statement by his son, Donald Trump Jr., about the 2016 Trump Tower/Russian lawyer meeting.
text.text: New York Times / The Trump Lawyers’ Confidential Memo to Mueller, Explained

text.headline: Trump tweets that he has the right to pardon himself and that the appointment of Mueller is unconstitutional.
text.text: Politico / Donald J. Trump on Twitter

text.headline: Trump says G7 summit nations "should let Russia come back in."
text.text: BBC / G7: Trump isolated over trade and Russia on first day

text.headline: Cohen tells Page Six that Trump is considering presidential run, spent $1 million on research.
text.text: Page Six / Trump researching 2016 run

text.headline: Christopher Steele writes in his dossier that a Kremlin insider told him "the importance of Trump lawyer Cohen in the ongoing secret liaison with the Kremlin," and that Cohen's role had grown.
text.text: DocumentCloud / Trump Intelligence Allegations

text.headline: Cohen tweets "I have never been to Prague in my life," refuting a charge from the Steele dossier that he met Russians there in 2016.
text.text: Twitter / Michael Cohen on Twitter

text.headline: Cohen meets with Russian oligarch Viktor Vekselberg at inauguration, according to NYT.
text.text: New York Times / Firm Tied to Russian Oligarch Made Payments to Michael Cohen

text.headline: A pro-Russia peace plan that would lift sanctions is hand-delivered to Flynn at the White House, according to the NYT. The White House later denied receiving the plan.
text.text: New York Times / A Back-Channel Plan for Ukraine and Russia, Courtesy of Trump Associates

text.headline: Trump atty Michael Cohen sends letter to Congressional investigators disputing the "dossier" made public in January.
text.text: Fox News / Trump attorney delivers point-by-point rebuttal of 'totally false' dossier

text.headline: The FBI raids Cohen's home, office and hotel room, seizing records. Reports indicate he is under investigation for campaign finance, bank fraud.
text.text: Washington Post / Trump attorney Cohen is being investigated for possible bank fraud, campaign finance violations

text.headline: Cohen asserts his Fifth Amendment right not to testify in the Stephanie Clifford (aka Stormy Daniels) case.
text.text: CNN / Michael Cohen asserts Fifth Amendment rights in Stormy Daniels case

text.headline: Trump tells Fox News that Cohen handled a "tiny, tiny fraction" of his legal work.
text.text: Washington Post / Trump’s unwieldy ‘Fox and Friends’ interview, annotated

text.headline: According to the AP, as early as this date, Paul Manafort pitched a plan to Russian oligarch Oleg Deripaska to consult for the Putin government. Manafort denies his work was pro-Russian. Deripaska sued for libel.
text.text: Associated Press / AP Exclusive: Before Trump job, Manafort worked to aid Putin

text.headline: In Ukraine, Yanukovych abruptly breaks with EU and embraces billions in aid from Moscow, contrary to Manafort's advice.
text.text: Reuters / Timeline: Political crisis in Ukraine and Russia's occupation of Crimea

text.headline: Manafort sends written pitch to Trump to work on the campaign.
text.text: New York Times / To Charm Trump, Paul Manafort Sold Himself as an Affordable Outsider

text.headline: Manafort hired by Trump campaign.
text.text: New York Times / Donald Trump Hires Paul Manafort to Lead Delegate Effort

text.headline: Near this date, Manafort meets with former Ukraine associate and Russian Army veteran Konstantin Kilimnik.
text.text: Washington Post / At height of Russia tensions, Trump campaign chairman Manafort met with business associate from Ukraine

text.headline: Manafort becomes campaign chairman.
text.text: Washington Post / Veteran strategist Paul Manafort becomes Trump’s campaign chairman

text.headline: As result of June 3 email, Russian lawyer meets at Trump Tower with Donald Trump. Jr, Kushner, Manafort and other Russians. Trump Jr. says the lawyer gave no information on Clinton or anything campaign-related
text.text: New York Times / What We Know About Donald Trump Jr.’s Russia Meeting

text.headline: Manafort takes over running Trump's campaign.
text.text: The Boston Globe / Donald Trump tries to hit reset by firing campaign manager Corey Lewandowski

text.headline: Manafort writes in an email that he is willing to brief a VIP believed to be Russian oligarch Oleg Deripaska, according to WaPo. It's unclear if the briefings happened.
text.text: Washington Post / Manafort offered to give Russian billionaire ‘private briefings’ on 2016 campaign

text.headline: Manafort strongly denies taking any "off-books" cash for work in Ukraine.
text.text: Politico / Trump campaign chair denies he accepted Ukraine cash payments

text.headline: Manafort resigns as Trump's campaign chair.
text.text: New York Times / Paul Manafort Quits Donald Trump’s Campaign After a Tumultuous Run

text.headline: Christopher Steele writes in his dossier that a Kremlin insider told him Manafort had led efforts for a secret Trump-campaign relationship with Russians, until his ouster.
text.text: DocumentCloud / Trump Intelligence Allegations

text.headline: Manafort tells CBS News that the Ukrainian government concluded the "Black Ledger" was falsified.
text.text: Kyiv Post / Manafort claims black ledger of secret payments was falsified - Dec. 10, 2016

text.headline: Manafort's son-in-law's real estate company declares bankruptcy, documents millions owed to Manafort.
text.text: US Bankrupcy Court

text.headline: Spicer says Manafort had a "very limited role" in the campaign. Politifact later rates that statement as false.
text.text: Politifact / Sean Spicer’s False claim that Paul Manafort played a minor role in the Trump campaign

text.headline: Ukrainian journalist and Manafort critic releases 2009 receipt showing payment to Manafort for computer equipment. The critic says it is a cover for laundering. Manafort allies say it is a fake document.
text.text: CNN / Paul Manafort faces new accusations in Ukraine after document find

text.headline: Report: NY attorney general and Manhattan's district attorney have opened investigations into Manafort real estate transactions.
text.text: Bloomberg / Manafort's Real-Estate Deals Said to Be Probed by N.Y.'s Top Cop

text.headline: NYT: Around this date, Putin ally and ex-Manafort associate Oleg Deripaska asks for immunity deal with Congres, but no deal is made.
text.text: New York Times / Russian Once Tied to Trump Aide Seeks Immunity to Cooperate With Congress

text.headline: Manafort associate Konstantin Kilimnik tells Washington Post he has no relation to Russian intelligence. Others insist he *was* connected.
text.text: Washington Post / At height of Russia tensions, Trump campaign chairman Manafort met with business associate from Ukraine

text.headline: Manafort registers retroactively as a foreign agent for his previous work in Urkaine.
text.text: NPR / Former Trump Campaign Manager Paul Manafort Registers As A Foreign Agent

text.headline: NYT reports Manafort owed millions to pro-Russia interests. Manafort spokesman says those debts are not current.
text.text: New York Times / Manafort Was in Debt to Pro-Russia Interests, Cyprus Records Show

text.headline: Manafort answers questions from Senate Intelligence Committee staff about 2016 meeting with Russian lawyer.
text.text: New York Times / Manafort Talks With Senate Investigators About Meeting With Russians

text.headline: The FBI raids Manafort's home in Virginia.
text.text: New York Times / With a Picked Lock and a Threatened Indictment, Mueller’s Inquiry Sets a Tone

text.headline: Manafort turns over about 400 pages of documents to Senate Judiciary Committee.
text.text: Bloomberg / Trump Campaign Turns Over Thousands of Documents in Russia Probe

text.headline: NBC News reports Mueller is now investigating Tony Podesta, brother of Clinton campaign Chairman John Podesta, for previous work regarding Ukraine that was connected to Manafort.
text.text: NBC News / Mueller Now Investigating Democratic Lobbyist Tony Podesta

text.headline: Manafort and his deputy, Rick Gates, are charged with a combined 12 counts of financial and foreign agent crimes.  They both plead not guilty. Manafort spokesman issues a sharp statement.
text.text: Washington Post / Three former Trump campaign officials charged by special counsel

text.headline: Mueller's team brings a second indictment, with 32 counts of tax and bank fraud, against Paul Manafort and Rick Gates.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: Gates pleads guilty to two lesser charges, becomes a cooperating witness in the Mueller investigation.
text.text: Washington Post / Former Trump campaign official Rick Gates pleads guilty to 2 charges

text.headline: Reuters reports that Manafort's ex-son-in-law Jeffrey Yohai agreed to a plea deal in a real estate case and may have to cooperate in Mueller probe.
text.text: Reuters / Exclusive: Manafort's former son-in-law cuts plea deal, to cooperate with government - sources

text.headline: Prosecutors with Mueller's team filed court documents accusing Manafort of trying to tamper with witnesses in his case.
text.text: DocumentCloud

text.headline: Mueller drops a new obstruction of justice indictment against Manafort and his associate Konstantin Kilimnik. They are the first charges against Kilimnik.
text.text: New York Times / Mueller Adds Obstruction Charge on Manafort and Indicts His Right-Hand Man

text.headline: As result of June 3 email, Russian lawyer meets at Trump Tower with Donald Trump. Jr, Kushner, Manafort and other Russians. Trump Jr. says the lawyer gave no information on Clinton or anything campaign-related
text.text: New York Times / What We Know About Donald Trump Jr.’s Russia Meeting

text.headline: Kushner submits a third security clearance form, amending it to include June 2016 meeting.
text.text: Yahoo / Sources: Trump lawyers knew of Russia emails three weeks ago

text.headline: Kushner releases statement about Russia meetings, asserts his innocence and meets privately with Senate committee staff.
text.text: New York Times / ‘I Did Not Collude,’ Kushner Says After Meeting Senate Investigators

text.headline: Kushner speaks privately with House Intelligence committee.
text.text: Reuters / Kushner interviewed by House intelligence panel

text.headline: Senate Judiciary Committee charges that Kushner did not disclose talks for a "backdoor" channel with Russians and emails about Wikileaks.
text.text: Washington Post / Senate Judiciary panel: Kushner had contacts about WikiLeaks, Russian overtures he did not disclose

text.headline: In email chain, Donald Trump Jr. agrees to meet with Russian officials, says "I love it" to their offer to damage Hillary Clinton.
text.text: New York Times / Read the Emails on Donald Trump Jr.’s Russia Meeting

text.headline: As result of June 3 email, Russian lawyer meets at Trump Tower with Donald Trump. Jr, Kushner, Manafort and other Russians. Trump Jr. says the lawyer gave no information on Clinton or anything campaign-related
text.text: New York Times / What We Know About Donald Trump Jr.’s Russia Meeting

text.headline: Donald Trump Jr. disputes Democratic claims about Russian hacking.
text.text: CNN / Transcripts

text.headline: Donald Trump Jr.reponds to a direct Twitter message from Wikileaks -- his first of three.
text.text: Twitter / Donald Trump Jr. on Twitter

text.headline: Donald Trump Jr. retweets a voter fraud allegation from the @Ten_GOP account later blocked by Twitter and reportedly run by Russian trolls.
text.text: The Daily Beast / Trump Campaign Staffers Pushed Russian Propaganda Days Before the Election

text.headline: Donald Trump Jr. releases statement about meeting with Russian lawyer.
text.text: CNBC / Here's Donald Trump Jr.'s full statement on his meeting with a Russian lawyer

text.headline: Donald Trump Jr. releases emails about meeting with Russian lawyer after offer of anti-Hillary Clinton material.
text.text: New York Times / Read the Emails on Donald Trump Jr.’s Russia Meeting

text.headline: Over this weekend, incoming White House Chief of Staff John Kelly reportedly tells Sessions his job is safe.
text.text: Bloomberg / Kelly Assures Sessions He Can Stay as Attorney General

text.headline: Reps. Mark Meadows and Jim Jordan write in an op-ed that it's time for Sessions to go.
text.text: Washington Examiner / Reps. Mark Meadows and Jim Jordan: It's time for Jeff Sessions to go, as shown by the latest FBI leak

text.headline: The NYT publishes Jan. letter by Trump's attorney asserting obstruction of justice charges could not apply to the president. The letter also indicates Trump dictated the statement by his son, Donald Trump Jr., about the 2016 Trump Tower/Russian lawyer meeting.
text.text: New York Times / The Trump Lawyers’ Confidential Memo to Mueller, Explained

text.headline: Trump and Flynn first meet, speak for 90 minutes.
text.text: Washington Post / Trump adviser Michael T. Flynn on his dinner with Putin and why Russia Today is just like CNN

text.headline: Flynn receives a $11,250 payment from a Russian freight company. Reason for the pay is unknown.
text.text: The Hill / Flynn took money from multiple Russian firms

text.headline: Flynn and his son meet with Russian ambassador Kislyak, seemingly at Flynn's request.
text.text: House of Representatives

text.headline: Flynn is a Trump adviser.
text.text: Reuters / Trump being advised by ex-U.S. Lieutenant General who favors closer Russia ties

text.headline: Flynn signs $600,000 contract to lobby for firm tied to Turkish government.
text.text: Politico / Flynn’s Turkish lobbying linked to Russia

text.headline: Flynn texts "Merry Christmas" to Kislyak.
text.text: CNN / Transcripts

text.headline: Flynn questioned by the FBI.
text.text: ABC News / A timeline of Sally Yates’ warnings to the White House about Mike Flynn

text.headline: White House learns Flynn misled Pence about his conversations with the Russians.
text.text: ABC News / A timeline of Sally Yates’ warnings to the White House about Mike Flynn

text.headline: Yates invites McGahn to DOJ to review Flynn files; it's unclear whether he came.
text.text: ABC News / A timeline of Sally Yates’ warnings to the White House about Mike Flynn

text.headline: A pro-Russia peace plan that would lift sanctions is hand-delivered to Flynn at the White House, according to the NYT. The White House later denied receiving the plan.
text.text: New York Times / A Back-Channel Plan for Ukraine and Russia, Courtesy of Trump Associates

text.headline: Flynn files financial disclosure form without citing Russian payments for speeches.
text.text: Fox News / Flynn initially failed to disclose Russia-linked payments on ethics form

text.headline: Reports: Flynn offered to testify to FBI, House, Senate in exchange for immunity. None took him up on the offer.
text.text: Wall Street Journal / Mike Flynn Offers to Testify in Exchange for Immunity

text.headline: In Russian TV interview, Kislyak insists he and Flynn never talked about sanctions, though reports indicated otherwise.
text.text: USA Today / Former Russian ambassador Kislyak denies discussing secrets or sanctions with Michael Flynn

text.headline: Flynn pleads guilty to lying to the FBI, indicating he will cooperate with Mueller.
text.text: PBS / Former Trump adviser Flynn pleads guilty to lying to FBI

text.headline: According to Papadopolous, a Trump "campaign supervisor," later identified as Sam Clovis, told him the campaign had a foreign policy goal of U.S.-Russia relations. Clovis' lawyer disputed that.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: In Italy, Papadopoulos meets "the professor," who claims to be close with Russian officials.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: Trump says Papadopoulos is on his campaign team.
text.text: Politico / Trump names foreign policy team members

text.headline: In London, the "professor" introduces Papadopoulos to a "native Russian female" contact, supposedly a Putin relative. Papadopolous emails his campaign supervisor, who responds "great work."
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: Trump meets with his natl security team, including Sessions and Papadopolous. The latter says he could arrange a meeting w/ Putin.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: Papadopoulos and his female Russian contact exchange emails about setting up a potential Russia trip.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: The "professor" introduces Papadopoulos to a person said to be connected to the Russian foreign ministry.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: Papadopoulos and his foreign ministry contact exchange more emails.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: Papadopoulos emails a senior campaign advisor indicating the Russians are ready to meet with Trump.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: The "professor" tells Papadopoulos that Russians have "thousands" of Hillary Clinton emails.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: Papadopoulos emails a senior campaign advisor that he has some interesting messages from Moscow.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: Russian foreign ministry contact emails Papadopoulos about a possible meeting in Moscow.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: The "professor" emails Papadopoulos, who then emails a high-ranking campaign official that Russia would like to host Trump.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: Papadopoulos emails another high-ranking campaign official about the idea of a Trump meeting with Russia.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: Papadopoulos emails a high-ranking campaign official and then his campaign supervisor about a Trump meeting with Russian officials.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: Papadopoulos writes the high-ranking campaign official that Russians would meet with him, off record, instead of Trump, if Trump is not an option.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: Papadopoulos' campaign supervisor writes to encourage him to attend an off-record trip to Russia, "if feasible."
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: The FBI interviews Papadopoulos a second time.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: Papadopolous deactives a Facebook account that contained some information about his contact with the "professor." His new account does not contain that information.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: Papadopoulos is arrested upon arrival at Dulles Airport outside of Washington.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: Papadopoulos signs plea agreement, stating he lied to the FBI in past interviews and indicating he is a cooperating witness.
text.text: US Department of Justice

text.headline: Mueller unseals Papadopoulos' Oct. 5 plea agreement, detailing Russia and campaign contacts.
text.text: Washington Post / Three former Trump campaign officials charged by special counsel

text.headline: Trump says Carter Page is on his campaign team.
text.text: Politico / Trump names foreign policy team members

text.headline: Page gives a lecture in Moscow.
text.text: You Tube / THE LECTURE OF TRUMP’S ADVISOR CARTER PAGE IN MOSCOW

text.headline: Around this time, an FBI informant meets Page at a conference.
text.text: New York Times / F.B.I. Used Informant to Investigate Russia Ties to Campaign, Not to Spy, as Trump Claims

text.headline: Trump campaign: Page is informal adviser.
text.text: Washington Post / Trump adviser’s public comments, ties to Moscow stir unease in both parties

text.headline: Trump team denies Page's role in campaign.
text.text: The Hill / Trump camp backs away from adviser suspected of Kremlin ties

text.headline: Page writes to FBI, saying he didn't meet with any "sanctioned" Russians.
text.text: Washington Post

text.headline: Page denies meeting Russians, takes leave from campaign.
text.text: Washington Post / Trump’s Russia adviser speaks out, calls accusations ‘complete garbage’

text.headline: Page travels to Moscow.
text.text: New York Times / Carter Page, Ex-Trump Adviser With Russian Ties, Visits Moscow

text.headline: Page tells PBS NewsHour he had no Russian meetings in the last year.
text.text: PBS / Former Trump adviser says he had no Russian meetings in the last year

text.headline: In reversal, Page says he did meet with Russians.
text.text: PBS / In a reversal, former Trump campaign adviser Carter Page now says he did have contact with Russia

text.headline: Page testifies behind closed doors before House Intelligence Committee, which later releases a transcript.
text.text: House of Representatives

text.headline: DOJ inspector general launches investigation of FBI, DOJ and possible abuse of FISA/surveillance powers, including with the Carter Page wiretaps.
text.text: Fox News / DOJ Inspector General reviews alleged FISA abuses by DOJ, FBI

text.headline: Stone leaves Trump campaign.
text.text: CNN / Roger Stone says he quit, Trump camp says it fired him

text.headline: Jeff Sessions, then a senator, appears at Trump rally wearing a 'Make America Great Again' hat.
text.text: Washington Post / What Jeff Sessions said about Russia, and when

text.headline: Sessions formally endorses Trump.
text.text: Politico / Sen. Jeff Sessions endorses Trump

text.headline: Sessions becomes chairman of the Trump campaign's national security advisory team.
text.text: CNN / Trump appoints Sessions National Security chairman

text.headline: The Trump campaign says Sessions will also lead Trump's foreign policy advisory team.
text.text: Breitbart / Trump Campaign Releases New Details About Sessions’ Role As Foreign Policy Adviser

text.headline: Sessions may have met with Kislyak.
text.text: CNN / First on CNN: Sources: Congress investigating another possible Sessions-Kislyak meeting

text.headline: Trump campaign signs contract with Cambridge Analytica, according to the Wall Street Journal.
text.text: Wall Street Journal / Data Firm’s WikiLeaks Outreach Came as It Joined Trump Campaign

text.headline: DNC Chair Debbie Wasserman-Schultz resigns.
text.text: The Atlantic / Debbie Wasserman Schultz Resigns as DNC Chair

text.headline: Roger Stone writes that Guccifer 2.0, not Russia, is responsible for hack.
text.text: Breitbart / Dear Hillary: DNC Hack Solved, So Now Stop Blaming Russia

text.headline: Stone says he has communicated with Wikileaks' Julian Assange.
text.text: Media Matters / Roger Stone Confirms That He's In Communication With Julian Assange

text.headline: Stone tweets Podesta's "time" is coming.
text.text: Twitter / Account Suspended

text.headline: Sessions meets with Kislyak.
text.text: Fox News / Sessions provides details on meetings with Russian ambassador

text.headline: Stone tweets "Wednesday @HillaryClinton is done. #Wikileaks."
text.text: Twitter / Account Suspended

text.headline: Stone indicates more coming from Wikileaks.
text.text: Twitter / Account Suspended

text.headline: Assange promises new Wikileaks info every week.
text.text: Fox News / WikiLeaks' 'October Surprise' fails; Assange promises more to come

text.headline: Podesta emails released by Wikileaks.
text.text: Politico / The most revealing Clinton campaign emails in WikiLeaks release

text.headline: Podesta: Trump campaign is connected to hackers.
text.text: Washington Post / Is there actually evidence that Trump allies had a heads-up on what WikiLeaks was doing?

text.headline: Stone: I have back channel to Assange.
text.text: CBS Miami / Trump Ally Roger Stone Admits ‘Back-Channel’ Tie To WikiLeaks

text.headline: Pence: The Trump campaign is not in cahoots with Wikipedia.
text.text: Politico / Pence denies Trump camp in cahoots with WikiLeaks

text.headline: Bloomberg report details Trump's digital strategy, including near total reliance on Facebook ads and data.
text.text: Bloomberg / Inside the Trump Bunker, With 12 Days to Go

text.headline: Trump campaign manager Kellyanne Conway retweets @Ten_GOP account later blocked by Twitter and reportedly run by Russian trolls.
text.text: The Daily Beast / Trump Campaign Staffers Pushed Russian Propaganda Days Before the Election

text.headline: Buzzfeed publishes dossier from former British intelligence officer, with lengthy and some salacious allegations of how Russians tried to compromise Trump and his campaign. Trump tweets it is "fake news."
text.text: BuzzFeed / These Reports Allege Trump Has Deep Ties To Russia

text.headline: Trump transition aide Anthony Scaramucci, hedge fund CEO, meets with Kirill Dmitriev of the Russian Direct Investment Fund in Davos. Length of meeting unclear. RDIF was under sanctions at time.
text.text: Bloomberg / Trump Aide Talks Investment With Sanctioned Kremlin Fund

text.headline: Russian tycoon and Putin ally Viktor Vekselberg attends Trump's inauguration, according to WaPo. The NYT reported he was the guest of his cousin and RNC donor Andrew Intrater and met with Michael Cohen.
text.text: Washington Post / In the crowd at Trump’s inauguration, members of Russia’s elite anticipated a thaw between Moscow and Washington

text.headline: Sessions comes under fire for not disclosing two meetings with Kislyak.
text.text: Washington Post / Sessions met with Russian envoy twice last year, encounters he later did not disclose

text.headline: Sessions recuses himself from any Russia investigations.
text.text: The Guardian / Jeff Sessions recuses himself from Russia inquiry amid calls for resignation

text.headline: Stone posts tweet about "perfectly legal back channel" with Assange, then deletes it.
text.text: The Guardian / Roger Stone claims he has 'perfectly legal back channel' to Julian Assange

text.headline: Sessions writes letter clarifying Senate testimony about contact with Russians.
text.text: Washington Post / In update to Congress, Sessions insists he was ‘correct’ to say he had no communication with Russians in campaign

text.headline: Sens. Patrick Leahy, D-Vt., and Al Franken, D-Minn., ask Comey to investigate whether Sessions perjured himself.
text.text: CNN / First on CNN: Senators asked Comey to investigate Sessions

text.headline: Sessions tells 'Today' show he is also recusing himself from any investigation of Flynn.
text.text: Politico / Sessions recuses himself from any Michael Flynn investigation

text.headline: Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein drafts a memo making a case for firing Comey, but only after he has been told that Comey is to be fired. It is not clear who directed him to write the memo.
text.text: Washington Post / Rosenstein defends his controversial memo used to justify Trump’s firing of Comey

text.headline: Trump confidant Christopher Ruddy, CEO of Newsmax Media, tells NewsHour he thinks the president is "considering perhaps terminating" Mueller.
text.text: PBS / Trump confidant: ‘I think he’s considering perhaps terminating the special counsel’

text.headline: Sessions testifies before Senate Intelligence Committee, insists he did nothing improper and declines to answer questions about conversations with President Trump.
text.text: PBS / What we learned at the Sessions hearing

text.headline: Pence hires a private attorney to represent him in the Russia investigation.
text.text: CNBC / Vice President Pence hires outside counsel to deal with Russia inquiries

text.headline: Trump's personal attorney, Michael Cohen, hires his own attorney to represent him in Russia probe.
text.text: Washington Post / Trump’s personal lawyer, Michael Cohen, hires his own lawyer in Russia probe

text.headline: Russian Ambassador Kislyak is recalled to Moscow.
text.text: BuzzFeed / Moscow Is Recalling Russia's Ambassador To The US Amid Election Controversy

text.headline: To NYT, Trump criticizes Sessions for recusing himself from Russia investigation.
text.text: New York Times / Excerpts From The Times’s Interview With Trump

text.headline: Sessions says he will serve "as long as appropriate."
text.text: NPR / After Trump Slams Sessions, Attorney General Says He Will Stay On The Job

text.headline: Anthony Scaramucci announced as new White House communications director.
text.text: USA Today / Anthony Scaramucci to be White House communications director

text.headline: Trump tells Wall Street Journal he's "just looking at" firing Sessions.
text.text: Wall Street Journal / Excerpts: Donald Trump’s Interview With The Wall Street Journal

text.headline: Russia's RT news runs story in which Veselnitskaya insists Broward lied to Senate and he is behind a smear campaign.
text.text: RT / Russia probe: Lawyer Veselnitskaya claims to have proof key witness to give false testimony

text.headline: Over this weekend, incoming White House Chief of Staff John Kelly reportedly tells Sessions his job is safe.
text.text: Bloomberg / Kelly Assures Sessions He Can Stay as Attorney General

text.headline: Scaramucci fired as White House communications director.
text.text: New York Times / John Kelly, Asserting Authority, Fires Anthony Scaramucci

text.headline: Sessions testifies before Senate, again insists he never colluded with Russians.
text.text: CNN / Jeff Sessions on Russia: 'I'm not part of a façade'

text.headline: Sessions tells House committee he now recalls the March 2016 meeting in which Papadopolous relayed he was in contact with Russians. Sessions says he does not recall exactly what Papadopolous said.
text.text: Washington Post / Sessions again changes his account of what he knew about Trump campaign’s dealings with Russians

text.headline: FBI deputy director Andrew McCabe is fired, officially due to actions connected to the Clinton investigation. McCabe asserted he was fired because of the Russia investigation.
text.text: The Atlantic / McCabe’s Firing Chips Away at the Justice Department’s Independence

text.headline: U.S. newly sanctions seven Russian oligarchs including Oleg Deripaska, who formerly worked with Manafort, and Viktor Vekselberg, who was at Trump's inauguration.
text.text: US Department of Treasury / Treasury Designates Russian Oligarchs, Officials, and Entities in Response to Worldwide Malign Activity

text.headline: Senate Leader Mitch McConnell says he will not allow a floor vote on a bill to protect special counsel Mueller.
text.text: The Guardian / McConnell says he will not allow vote on bill protecting Mueller from firing

text.headline: Trump tweets he wished he had picked someone other than Sessions as attorney general.
text.text: Twitter / Donald J. Trump on Twitter

text.headline: Trump tweets about Sessions again, blaming him for the continuing Russia investigation. "I would have quickly picked someone else," Trump says.
text.text: Twitter / Donald J. Trump on Twitter
